content:
TITLE: Loading MCMC Samples in Python
DESCRIPTION: Code example showing how to load MCMC samples from files into a GetDist MCSamples object with optional analysis settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from getdist import loadMCSamples
samples = loadMCSamples('/path/to/xxx', settings={'ignore_rows':0.3})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating 2D Parameter Plots
DESCRIPTION: Example of creating 2D marginalized parameter density plots using GetDist's plotting functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from getdist import plots
g = plots.get_single_plotter()
g.plot_2d(samples, ['x1', 'x2'])
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Comparing Multiple Chain Results
DESCRIPTION: Code showing how to compare results from multiple MCMC chains by plotting 2D constraints from different files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from getdist import plots
g = plots.get_single_plotter(chain_dir='/path/to/', analysis_settings={'ignore_rows':0.3})
g.plot_2d(['xxx','yyy'], ['x', 'y'])
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing GetDist using pip
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing GetDist either from PyPI or from source code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ pip install getdist

$ pip install -e /path/to/source/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Python Package Dependencies for GetDist
DESCRIPTION: This requirements specification lists the Python packages and their version constraints needed for the GetDist library. It requires numpy 1.23.0 or newer, matplotlib 2.2.0 or newer (excluding version 3.5.0), scipy 1.5.0 or newer, PyYAML 5.1 or newer, and packaging with no version constraint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/requirements.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
numpy>=1.23.0
matplotlib>=2.2.0,!=3.5.0
scipy>=1.5.0
PyYAML>=5.1
packaging
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PySide6 for GetDist GUI in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install PySide6, which is required to run the GetDist GUI. It uses pip to install the package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/docs/source/gui.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install PySide6
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Conda Environment with GetDist GUI Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a new Conda environment named 'myenv' with all the necessary dependencies for running the GetDist GUI, including PySide6. It uses the conda-forge channel to ensure compatibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/docs/source/gui.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda create -n myenv -c conda-forge scipy matplotlib PyYAML PySide6
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running GetDist Unit Tests
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the GetDist unit test suite to verify installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ python -m unittest getdist.tests.getdist_test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GetDist MCSamples Module Documentation
DESCRIPTION: ReStructuredText documentation directives for the mcsamples module, specifying the documentation structure for the loadMCSamples function, MCSamples class, and error classes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/docs/source/mcsamples.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: restructuredtext
CODE:
```
.. automodule:: getdist.mcsamples
   :members: loadMCSamples

.. autoclass:: getdist.mcsamples.MCSamples
   :members:
   :inherited-members:


.. automodule:: getdist.mcsamples
   :members: MCSamplesError, ParamError, SettingError
   :noindex:
```

----------------------------------------

```
   :members:
```

TITLE: Setting GetDist Project URL in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets the URL for the GetDist project documentation. It appears to be part of a larger configuration or setup file for the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
url = "https://getdist.readthedocs.io"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Program Copyright Notice Template for GNU GPL
DESCRIPTION: A template for the copyright notice that should be attached to the start of each source file when applying the GNU GPL to a program. It includes placeholders for program name, copyright year, and author name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/LICENCE.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plain text
CODE:
```
<one line to give the program's name and a brief idea of what it does.>
Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
(at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
along with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Terminal Interaction Copyright Notice for GNU GPL Programs
DESCRIPTION: A template for the short copyright notice that should be displayed when a GNU GPL program starts in interactive mode. It includes placeholders for program name, year, and author, plus instructions for showing warranty and conditions information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cmbant/getdist/blob/master/LICENCE.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plain text
CODE:
```
<program>  Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>
This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'.
This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it
under certain conditions; type `show c' for details.
```
